intro: Swertia mildbraedii, commonly known as the Himalayan gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with a fine layer of white hairs. Swertia mildbraedii is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
